Nono Sampono : DPD Bentuk Pansus Papua, 15 Orang Dipimpin Fachrul Razi
02 Nov 2019, 16:05 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


Nono Sampono : DPD Bentuk Pansus Papua, 15 Orang Dipimpin Fachrul Razi

KBRN, Jakarta : Salah satu program dalam waktu dekat ini segera dilakukan oleh Dewan Perwakilan Daerah (DPD) RI adalah pembentukan Panitia Khusus (Pansus) untuk Papua. Hal ini diungkapkan Wakil Ketua DPD RI Nono Sampono dalam siaran langsung dengan RRI PRO3 usai acara Pers Gathering yang mengangkat tema 'Sinergitas DPD RI dan Insan Pers Guna Penguatan Peran DPD RI Dalam Memperjuangkan Aspirasi Daerah' di Surabaya, Jumat (1/11/2019) malam. Nono lanjut menuturkan, DPD menilai, masalah Papua yang berada di wilayah timur Indonesia, menjadi persoalan yang harus segera diselesaikan."Saya baru pulang dari Manokwari, Sorong, Raja Ampat, Sorong, karena saat letupan awal memang berawal dari Manokwari dan Sorong baru melebar ke wilayah lain, sampai baru-baru ini Wamena," sebut Nono kepada RRI.Untuk kerusuhan terakhir yang terjadi di Wamena, dirinya bersyukur pemerintah melalui TNI-Polri telah menempuh langkah-langkah baik guna menyelesaikan persoalan awal dengan pendekatan keamanan dan hukum. Dan untuk meneruskannya, DPD RI, kata dia, ingin menyelesaikan persoalan sampai ke akar masalah.Akar masalahnya menurut Nono adalah keadilan, sosial, budaya, kemudian pendidikan, layanan kesehatan, dan harus ditempuh melalui pendekatan-pendekatan kultural. Selain itu, ekonomi juga perlu tumbuh agar masyarakat di sana meningkat pula penghasilan dan kesejahteraannya."Papua dan Papua Barat itu nomor satu dan nomor dua provinsi miskin di Indonesia selain Maluku, NTT dan Gorontalo. Lima besar miskin itu," ujarnya.Mengenai Pansus, nantinya tim akan bekerja membantu pemerintah dalam hal ini bagaimana segera cari solusi penyelesaian akar masalah di Papua."Pansus nanti ada 15 orang, dipimpin Wakil Ketua I dari Komite I DPD RI, Fachrul Razi," pungkasnya. (Sumber: Jorike Fitri/RRI-PRO3)

Nono Sampono: DPD Forms Papua Special Committee, 15 People Led by Fachrul Razi
02 Nov 2019, 16:05 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


Nono Sampono: DPD Forms Papua Special Committee, 15 People Led by Fachrul Razi

KBRN, Jakarta: One of the programs that will soon be carried out by the Indonesian Regional Representative Council (DPD) is the formation of a Special Committee (Pansus) for Papua. This was revealed by Deputy Chairman of the DPD RI Nono Sampono in a live broadcast with RRI PRO3 after the Press Gathering event with the theme 'Synergy of the DPD RI and Press Persons to Strengthen the Role of the DPD RI in Fighting for Regional Aspirations' in Surabaya, Friday (1/11/2019) night. Nono went on to say, the DPD considered that the problem of Papua in eastern Indonesia was a problem that had to be resolved immediately. "I just returned from Manokwari, Sorong, Raja Ampat, Sorong, because when the initial explosion did start from Manokwari and Sorong just widened to other regions, until recently Wamena, "Nono said to RRI. For the latest unrest that occurred in Wamena, he was grateful the government through the TNI-Polri had taken good steps to resolve the initial problem with a security and legal approach. And to continue, the DPD RI, he said, wanted to solve the problem to the root of the problem. The problem according to Nono was justice, social, culture, then education, health services, and had to be taken through cultural approaches. In addition, the economy also needs to grow so that the people there also increase their income and welfare. "Papua and West Papua are number one and number two poor provinces in Indonesia besides Maluku, NTT and Gorontalo. The top five are poor," he said. Regarding the Special Committee, later the team will work to help the government in this matter how to immediately find solutions to solve the root problems in Papua. "There will be 15 special committee members, led by Deputy Chair I of the Committee I DPD RI, Fachrul Razi," he concluded. (Source: Jorike Fitri / RRI-PRO3)
